intro: Jamesbrittenia argentea, commonly known as silverbrite, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, delicate white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
